alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 12 at 12:12PM EST until March 13 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW EXPECTED TODAY... .Low pressure near the Mid Atlantic coastline continues to rapidly intensify as it races northeast through the Gulf of Maine this afternoon. Heavy snowfall and snowfall rates of greater than 1 inch per hour are expected in the warning area. Rain changing to a wet snow will lead to slippery travel conditions in the advisory area. Some power outages can be expected. The precipitation will begin to diminish later this evening. However, strong northwesterly winds will continue overnight into Sunday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches for a storm total of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern New Hampshire and west central and western Maine. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For a more precise forecast for your specific location...go to www.weather.gov/gray..
